ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team06.UI

Class ShellyTab

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team06.UI.ShellyTab

  • public class ShellyTab
extends java.lang.Object
    Tab for the Shelly component. This tab will house an image of Shelly and display the amount of experience the user has earned by fulfilling athletic tasks. It is also in charge of the customization options for shelly and keeping track of when they're unlocked.
    Author:
    Team06

      • saveItem

        public void saveItem(java.lang.String item,
                     shellyExperience shelly,
                     java.lang.String itemType)
        the saveItem method is responsible for storing the user chosen customizations as strings to be loaded in from the experience.dat file. The system message "save successful" will display upon each chosen item, accurately updating and reflecting the serialized items.
        Parameters:
        item - is the physical item
        shelly - is the snail object that has this all serialized to it
        itemType - is either a hat, body, or shell

      • shellyExperience

        public void shellyExperience()
        Gives shelly the experience earned by user for the day

      • giveExperience

        public void giveExperience(shellyExperience shelly,
                           int experienceEarned)
        Method used to calculated "experience overflow," takes an int and shellyExperience object. In the event the user earns an amount of experience greater than needed to level up, we dont want all that extra effort wasted. The experience overflows into the next experience level and gives the user the exp they earned correctly. An overflow integer will keep track of the experience the user has over the limit, and a boolean flag will queue the method in if there is still experience to be distributed into the next experience tier.
        Parameters:
        shelly - is the shelly object tracking user exp
        experienceEarned - represents the amount the user earned over the exp threshold

      • updateProgressBar

        public void updateProgressBar(int exp)
        Self explanatory, simply updates the progress bar to show the correct amount of current/total experience.
